intro: Ulmus carpinifolia var. italica, commonly known as the Italian elm, is a deciduous tree native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are often slightly hairy on the underside. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in early spring, followed by winged fruits that aid in seed dispersal. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has a moderate growth rate. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in gardens and urban landscapes.
